message.content:
cs.MA, cs.RO, cs.DC, cs.LO, cs.PL 

The paper focuses on the problem of rendezvous of robots in a continuous environment, which is a common topic in the fields of multi-agent systems (cs.MA) and robotics (cs.RO). The use of model-checking techniques to verify the correctness of distributed algorithms is a topic in the field of distributed computing (cs.DC). The paper also discusses the design decisions made to keep the search space finite and tractable, which is a topic in the field of logic in computer science (cs.LO). Finally, the paper deals with the problem of using lights to solve rendezvous, which is a topic in the field of programming languages (cs.PL) as it involves designing algorithms that manipulate the behavior of the robots.
